messages.content: What was removed in version 0.33 of Endless-Nodes?
The Aesthetic Scorer and ImageReward were removed until the reason behind the CLIP module not working for some people is figured out.
What was the main feature of version 0.32?
The Image Saver was added in version 0.32, which saves images and JSON to separate folders upon request.
What improvements were made in version 0.31?
In version 0.31, there was a release of V0.28 functionality (int, float, num to X), added conversion of String to X, code cleanup, vanity node renaming, and recategorization.
What did version 0.30 mainly focus on?
Version 0.30 focused on squishing bugs in the various X to X nodes.
What was added in version 0.29?
The Save Image module was added in version 0.29, enabling saving images and JSON to a separate folder if requested.
What was the main change in version 0.28?
Version 0.28 introduced Variable types to X.
What was being started in version 0.27?
In version 0.27, a start was being made to correct scoring and integrate it into image metadata.
What was new in version 0.26?
Version 0.26 introduced various X to String nodes.
What changes were made in version 0.24?
Version 0.24 introduced the In Image Reward scoring model, added a single node to load the model and output standard deviation and scoring via number or string nodes.
What was the major update in version 0.23?
In version 0.23, the Aesthetic Score model was reworked and integrated into a single node to display the score, and a requirements file was added.
What was the notable feature in version 0.22?
Version 0.22 attempted to convert ImageReward output to a base ten score.
What was introduced in version 0.21?
In version 0.21, the Aesthetic Scorer was introduced, nodes were categorized into submenus, vanity coding was added to node names, and the ComfyUI manager header text was changed.
What was the focus of version 0.20?
Version 0.20 started the skeleton for the Save Image feature.
What was added in version 0.19?
Version 0.19 attempted to implement basic display nodes.
What was new in version 0.18?

Version 0.18 added Combo Parameterizers to reduce the number of nodes, allowing for common resolution parameters to go to both pos/neg CLIP encode and adding separate pos/neg aesthetic score. Also, there was a version with separate pos/neg prompts.
What was added in version 0.16?
Version 0.16 added the Eight Input Number String.
What was the main feature of version 0.15?
Version 0.15 added Combo Parameterizers, which reduced the number of nodes, allowed for common resolution parameters to go to both pos/neg CLIP encode, and added separate pos/neg aesthetic scores.
What was the main change in version 0.14?
Version 0.14 introduced the Parameterizer, which allows for parameters to be added to CLIP Encode.
What was the main development in version 0.13?
In version 0.13, typos were fixed, and the Parameterizer with Prompt was added (although it was unreleased to GitHub at that time).
What was the main addition in version 0.12?
Version 0.12 introduced the Parameterizer, which allows for parameters to be added to CLIP Encode.
What was the feature of version 0.10?
Version 0.10 added the Six Input Number Widget, marking the first release to GitHub.
What was the main focus of version 0.05?
In version 0.05, the Six Input Number String was added.
What was the basic flow for version 0.00?
The basic flow for version 0.00 was centered around the Six Input Text Switch.
What is Endless-Nodes and what does it do?

Endless-Nodes is a set of custom nodes for the ComfyUI user interface for Stable Diffusion that extends its functionality. It includes features such as an image saver, aesthetic scoring models, converters, switches, and parameter collection nodes.
What are the features of the Endless-Nodes Image Saver?

The Endless-Nodes Image Saver allows saving images and JSON files to the base folder, custom folders for one or both, and supports Python timestamping. Moreover, it enables turning off JSON add to Image Metadata if a user chooses.
What are the Aesthetic Scorer and Image Reward in Endless-Nodes?

Aesthetic Scorer and Image Reward are nodes in Endless-Nodes that output predicted aesthetic scores as numbers. They are based on different models: the first uses the AUTO1111 model, while the second is based on Image Reward, which uses Reward Feedback Learning (ReFL) and 137K human-scored input samples. They add around 7-10 seconds to a workflow on average.
What does the Endless Nodes Parameterizer node do?

The Endless Nodes Parameterizer collects inputs for the CLIP text Encoder and Refiners for SDXL based workflows. It includes settings for base and refiner resolution and provides separate aesthetic score values for positive and negative CLIPs.
How do I install Endless-Nodes?

To install Endless-Nodes, navigate to your /ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ folder, right-click to start a command prompt and type 'git clone https://github.com/tusharbhutt/Endless-Nodes'. Alternatively, you can get the nodes via the [ComfyUI Manager](https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager).
What is the license for Endless-Nodes and are there any usage restrictions?

Endless-Nodes is licensed under GPL Licensing V3. Users may modify the code, but must keep the credits for this repository and those noted in the credit section. Additionally, the nodes may not be used to create any images or artwork that violates the Stable Diffusion usage notes, including the creation of fake celebrity nudes or sexual content of any person, even with consent.
